ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Who hinders men from (doing) good, the transgressor, the iniquitous,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: the hinderer of good, the transgressor, the sinful;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: One who excessively forbids the good, transgressor, sinner.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Hinderer of the good, transgressor, sinful,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Forbidder of good, outstepping the limits, sinful,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: hinderer of good, guilty aggressor, coarse-grained,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Hinderer of the good, transgressor, malefactor
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: or to one who places obstacles in the way of good being done or to the wicked transgressor,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Hinderer of the good, trespasser; sinner.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: hinderer of all good, sinful transgressor,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (Habitually) hindering (all) good, transgressing beyond bounds, deep in sin,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Hinderer of the good, transgressor, sinful,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: those who hinder good, the guilty aggressor,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: A preventer of good, transgressing and sinful,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [68:12] hinderer of good, niggardly with his wealth against deserving causes, sinful transgressor, wrongdoer,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Hinderer of the good) hinderer of Islam, for he prevented his sons and relatives from embracing Islam, (transgressor) he transgressed, Muhammad, against the Truth and wronged them, (malefactor) sinful
